comment: I had Professor Moritz for Environments for Animation; he does have a pretty clear assignment schedule so for the most part it is consistent. However, his projects vary in painting quantity very quickly. Also, I was not comfortable asking him for critique. Critiques are not always positive but the way he spoke to students was not generally kind.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I highly recommend to avoid this professor at all cost! Even if you see him as the option to take him he isn't worth it and you will not learn nothing. Encourages AI usage and very disrespectful in critiques.

Please do not take this professor if you have other options. I am currently taking him and he is extremely nitpicky, will expect you to have a masterpiece despite not telling you what to add beforehand. If you ask for further critique he comes across as extremely passive aggressive and grades based off vibes, not effort put in. Encourages AI usage.
Very little work to do and a very relaxed Prof! Absolutely take this class if you're looking for an easy credit with a chill Professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: We just read a book and completed modules based off what chapter we read. There were about 15 modules, but you only had to do 4 of them. They were all very easy. Just answer the question and then respond to someone else.

TAKE HIM! Tests are easy but with 1hr time limit. All modules have presentations that are helpful and u need to know them to pass tests (most are short). U have to do at least 4/10 discussions to pass that part but you still have to take tests. For every discussion, you have to reply to 1 person with at least 50 words. Easy class, just manage time.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I suggest having him online for this class. There is a textbook you can read but it's only for assignments, but, you might have to rely on Google a bit. He has slideshows that go over what you REALLY need to know for the tests/modules. The tests are short and VERY easy to answer, BUT, there is a one-hour time limit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: The workload is overwhelming. I had double the amount of work as my other studio classes. Balancing other classes, this class, and a job is near impossible. He doesn't teach techniques, and opens students projects in photoshop during critique to fix them himself in front of the class. The grading is unclear and seems like it varies based on mood.

This is my second class with Moritz, and I really enjoyed it. He gives detailed feedback and also does the project with students so the lectures are very helpful. He genuinely cares a lot about students growth and I have made some of my best work in this class! Only downside is short deadlines, but if you go to class you should be ok.

Mr Moritz is condescending and flat out rude. I feel this could be due to his lack of experience in his field.
He is incredibly inpatient and not willing to work with certain students.
The grading method used is a mystery so there for it is difficult to fully understand what he wants in a project.
I feel this class was a waste of time.

I actually really enjoyed this class, he cut out a project for extra time which gave us plenty for each project. Some were graded harsh BUT he lets you redo anything for near full credit so you can apply any feedback youre given which is great. He cares a lot about students and has a lot of industry knowledge and shows a LOT of his work...
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: The worst teacher I've ever had. He would ignore me at times, not allow me to think outside the box, suggested I stop doing my normal style and ask if I think I'm "cut out" for animation. There was more incidents. I nearly dropped out of my major. My mental still hasn't fully recovered. It's clear he wants animation done a certain way.

I picked up animation quick, so the class was fun and easy to follow for me. For those who did not pick it up quick, Moritz seemed to dislike. I was offered lots of helpful feedback and succeeded a lot with his help. However I did notice this treatment was not given to all students

This class is a boot camp. He acts like this is your only class as well. He'll berate you for asking questions about assignments and scheduling and then miscommunicates those exact things you were trying to ask him and acts like it is your fault. His critiques are ruthless/humiliating and he grades based on criteria he never mentions in class.

He started out so rude and harsh on our class that another faculty member had to speak with him about his behavior. Several students dropped the class because of this. He spent so much of our class time working on his own projects instead of helping us with ours. He never gave rubrics so it was always stressful to figure out what he wanted. AVOID

I want to be motion designer so naturally this class was pretty easy for me, however, this is not because of this professor. This professor talks down to his students and is very full of himself. For the whole first hour of every class he will talk about himself and how awesome he is. I can't handle men who wish they could date themself.

He does not put up what is to be done for the assignment, he just gives you a brief overview of what he wants. Then when you do the project he tells you how bad it is and you should've done it his way. Talks about his work and how good he is (which he's not) Not a helpful teacher. He expects you to know what he wants without telling you what to do.

I had a good experience in this class. He is lenient in terms of project due dates and attendance, and understands that each student is at a different skill level. He does his own version of every project during class, so you understand what tools to use, and what he expects each project should look like. Overall an interesting and fun class.

Very egotistical professor. Treats everyone's projects as if they were his own and will grade as so. If your project is not the way he wants it he will deduct points. Spends a lot of class time talking about his own works rather than teaching students or allowing time to work. Does not grade through a rubric, grades on the whim

This was a pretty terrible experience. The teacher has no grading rubric, little experience in his career field or teaching, and unfortunately I cant even say he was a nice guy. He often grades based on how much he likes the art rather than how good it is, and has even taken the pen to students arts and redrawn it for them. Very hard to pass.
